question: 殻
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well. Just remember that this word can be used for both animal and seed shells.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

<vocabulary>Shell</vocabulary>s come from (<ja><reading>から</reading></ja>) living animals. You can't have a shell — or a <reading>cara</reading>pace (<ja>から</ja>) — unless something was once in there. They have to come from something.

This word isn't limited to animal shells though! It covers seed shells, or husks, too.
